00001 /********************************************************************\
00002 
00003 Name:         MCombinePulses
00004 Created by:   Andrew Edmonds
00005 
00006 Contents:     One module that fills out histograms for the pulse heights, pulse shapes and the raw counts for all digitizer channels. These are all in one module to be more efficient in terms of minimising the number of times we loop through the channels.
00007 
00008 \********************************************************************/
00009

00047 static std::vector<std::string> left_thin_banknames;
00048 static std::vector<std::string> right_thin_banknames;
00049 static TH2D* hSiL1PulseShapes;
00050 static TH2D* hSiR1PulseShapes;
00051 static TH1I* hSiL1PulseHeights;
00052 static TH1I* hSiR1PulseHeights;

00070 INT MCombinePulses_init()
00071 {
00072   // The following histograms are created for each channel:
00073   // hPulseHeights: ADC value (x-axis) vs number of pulses (y-axis)
00074   // hPulseTimes: time stamp (x-axis) vs number of pulses (y-axis)
00075   // hPulseRawCount: number of pulses (y-axis) - channels on x-axis?
00076   // hPulseShapes: sample number (x-axis) vs ADC value (y-axis) vs pulse (z-axis)
00077 
00078   std::map<std::string, std::string> bank_to_detector_map = gSetup->fBankToDetectorMap;
00079   for(std::map<std::string, std::string>::iterator mapIter = bank_to_detector_map.begin(); 
00080       mapIter != bank_to_detector_map.end(); mapIter++) { 
00081 
00082     std::string bankname = mapIter->first;
00083     std::string detname = gSetup->GetDetectorName(bankname);
00084 
00085     if (detname.substr(0,4) == "SiL1" && detname.substr(7,1) == "S")
00086       left_thin_banknames.push_back(bankname);
00087     else if (detname.substr(0,4) == "SiR1" && detname.substr(7,1) == "S")
00088       right_thin_banknames.push_back(bankname);
00089   }
00090 
00091   long max_adc_value = 13000;
00092 
00093   // hSiL1PulseShapes
00094   std::string histname = "hSiL1PulseShapes";
00095   std::string histtitle = "Plot of the combined pulse shapes in SiL1";
00096   hSiL1PulseShapes = new TH2D(histname.c_str(), histtitle.c_str(), 64,-0.5,63.5,max_adc_value+1,0,max_adc_value+1);      
00097   hSiL1PulseShapes->GetXaxis()->SetTitle("Time Stamp");
00098   hSiL1PulseShapes->GetYaxis()->SetTitle("ADC Value");
00099 
00100   // hSiR1PulseShapes
00101   histname = "hSiR1PulseShapes";
00102   histtitle = "Plot of the combined pulse shapes in SiR1";
00103   hSiR1PulseShapes = new TH2D(histname.c_str(), histtitle.c_str(), 64,-0.5,63.5,max_adc_value+1,0,max_adc_value+1);      
00104   hSiR1PulseShapes->GetXaxis()->SetTitle("Time Stamp");
00105   hSiR1PulseShapes->GetYaxis()->SetTitle("ADC Value");
00106 
00107   // hSiL1PulseHeights
00108   histname = "hSiL1PulseHeights";
00109   histtitle = "Plot of the combined pulse heights in SiL1";
00110   hSiL1PulseHeights = new TH1I(histname.c_str(), histtitle.c_str(), max_adc_value+1,0,max_adc_value+1);      
00111   hSiL1PulseHeights->GetXaxis()->SetTitle("ADC Value");
00112   hSiL1PulseHeights->GetYaxis()->SetTitle("Number of Pulses");
00113 
00114   // hSiR1PulseHeights
00115   histname = "hSiR1PulseHeights";
00116   histtitle = "Plot of the combined pulse heights in SiR1";
00117   hSiR1PulseHeights = new TH1I(histname.c_str(), histtitle.c_str(), max_adc_value+1,0,max_adc_value+1);      
00118   hSiR1PulseHeights->GetXaxis()->SetTitle("ADC Value");
00119   hSiR1PulseHeights->GetYaxis()->SetTitle("Number of Pulses");
00120 
00121   return SUCCESS;
00122 }
00123 
00124 // Resets the histograms at the beginning of each run so that the online display updates
00125 INT MCombinePulses_bor(INT run_number) {
00126 
00127   hSiL1PulseShapes->Reset();  
00128   hSiR1PulseShapes->Reset();
00129   hSiL1PulseHeights->Reset();  
00130   hSiR1PulseHeights->Reset();
00131 }
00132 
00136 INT MCombinePulses(EVENT_HEADER *pheader, void *pevent)
00137 {
00138         // Get the event number
00139         int midas_event_number = pheader->serial_number;
00140 
00141         // Some typedefs
00142         typedef map<string, vector<TPulseIsland*> > TStringPulseIslandMap;
00143         typedef pair<string, vector<TPulseIsland*> > TStringPulseIslandPair;
00144         typedef map<string, vector<TPulseIsland*> >::iterator map_iterator;
00145 
00146         // Fetch a reference to the gData structure that stores a map
00147         // of (bank_name, vector<TPulseIsland*>) pairs
00148         TStringPulseIslandMap& pulse_islands_map =
00149                 gData->fPulseIslandToChannelMap;
00150 
00152         // SiL
00153         // Just loop over the banks we know are connected to these detectors
00154         std::vector<std::vector<TPulseIsland*> > thinSiLeftPulses;
00155         for (std::vector<std::string>::iterator bankNameIter = left_thin_banknames.begin();
00156              bankNameIter != left_thin_banknames.end(); bankNameIter++) {
00157 
00158           std::vector<TPulseIsland*> temp_vector = gData->fPulseIslandToChannelMap[*bankNameIter];
00159           //skip bank if it doesen't exist
00160           if (temp_vector.size() == 0) continue;
00161             
00162           thinSiLeftPulses.push_back(temp_vector);
00163         }
00164         std::vector<std::vector<int> > allPulses = SumPulses(thinSiLeftPulses, 1000);
00165 
00166         for (std::vector<std::vector<int> >::iterator allPulseIter = allPulses.begin(); allPulseIter != allPulses.end(); ++allPulseIter) {
00167           
00168           // While filling the persistent scope histogram, look for the minimum sample value for the pulse height
00169           int min_sample_value = 99999;
00170           for (std::vector<int>::iterator sampleIter = (*allPulseIter).begin(); sampleIter != (*allPulseIter).end(); ++sampleIter) {
00171 
00172             //      printf("Filling %d at position %d\n", *sampleIter, sampleIter - (*allPulseIter).begin());
00173             if (*sampleIter < min_sample_value)
00174               min_sample_value = *sampleIter;
00175 
00176             hSiL1PulseShapes->Fill(sampleIter - (*allPulseIter).begin(), *sampleIter);
00177           }
00178 
00179           // Take into account the number of channels seen otherwise we get a 4 peak plot
00180           if (min_sample_value < 6000)
00181             min_sample_value /= 2;
00182           else if (min_sample_value < 9000)
00183             min_sample_value /= 3;
00184           else if (min_sample_value < 12000)
00185             min_sample_value /= 4;
00186 
00187           hSiL1PulseHeights->Fill( -1*(min_sample_value - ((thinSiLeftPulses[0])[0])->GetPedestal(10)) );
00188         }
00190 
00191 
00192 
00194         // SiR
00195         // Just loop over the banks we know are connected to these detectors
00196         std::vector<std::vector<TPulseIsland*> > thinSiRightPulses;
00197         for (std::vector<std::string>::iterator bankNameIter = right_thin_banknames.begin();
00198              bankNameIter != right_thin_banknames.end(); bankNameIter++) {
00199 
00200           std::vector<TPulseIsland*> temp_vector = gData->fPulseIslandToChannelMap[*bankNameIter];
00201           //skip bank if it doesen't exist
00202           if (temp_vector.size() == 0) continue;
00203             
00204           thinSiRightPulses.push_back(temp_vector);
00205         }
00206         allPulses = SumPulses(thinSiRightPulses, 1000);
00207 
00208         for (std::vector<std::vector<int> >::iterator allPulseIter = allPulses.begin(); allPulseIter != allPulses.end(); ++allPulseIter) {
00209           
00210           // While filling the persistent scope histogram, look for the minimum sample value for the pulse height
00211           int min_sample_value = 99999;
00212           for (std::vector<int>::iterator sampleIter = (*allPulseIter).begin(); sampleIter != (*allPulseIter).end(); ++sampleIter) {
00213 
00214             //      printf("Filling %d at position %d\n", *sampleIter, sampleIter - (*allPulseIter).begin());
00215             if (*sampleIter < min_sample_value)
00216               min_sample_value = *sampleIter;
00217 
00218             hSiR1PulseShapes->Fill(sampleIter - (*allPulseIter).begin(), *sampleIter);
00219           }
00220 
00221           // Take into account the number of channels seen otherwise we get a 4 peak plot
00222           if (min_sample_value < 6000)
00223             min_sample_value /= 2;
00224           else if (min_sample_value < 9000)
00225             min_sample_value /= 3;
00226           else if (min_sample_value < 12000)
00227             min_sample_value /= 4;
00228 
00229           hSiR1PulseHeights->Fill( -1*(min_sample_value - ((thinSiRightPulses[0])[0])->GetPedestal(10)) );
00230         }
00232         return SUCCESS;
00233 }
00234 
00235 // SumPulses()
00236 // -- Creates a vector of sample vectors from a vector of TPulseIsland vectors
00237 // -- This function also checks that the pulses are within a certain time difference of each other
00238 std::vector<std::vector<int> > SumPulses(std::vector<std::vector<TPulseIsland*> > pulses, double time_difference) {
00239 
00240   // Create the iterators
00241   std::vector<std::vector<TPulseIsland*>::iterator > pulseIters;
00242   std::vector<std::vector<TPulseIsland*>::iterator > backwardIters;
00243 
00244   for (int b = 0; b < pulses.size(); b++) {
00245     pulseIters.push_back((pulses.at(b)).begin()); 
00246     backwardIters.push_back((pulses.at(b)).end());
00247   }
00248 
00249   // Prepare the output map:
00250   std::vector<std::vector<int> > output;
00251 
00252   while ( pulseIters.size() > 0 ) {
00253 
00254     //Iterators/pointers into pulseIters and backwardIters must not be held past
00255     //one loop cycle as they may become invalidated.
00256 
00257     //Get the time of the next (unused) TPulseIslands (one from each bank)
00258     //work out which is the earliest
00259     double min_time = 99999999999.;  //something huge.
00260     for (int b = 0; b < pulseIters.size(); ++b){
00261       double time = (*(pulseIters.at(b)))->GetPulseTime();
00262       min_time = std::min(min_time , time);
00263       //      printf("Bank #%d: time = %f ms\n", b, time * 1e-6);
00264       //Or use GetTimeStamp()?
00265     }
00266     //    printf("Min time = %f ms\n", min_time*1e-6);
00267 
00268     //Sum all the pulseHeights at a given time 
00269     std::vector<int> temp_output;
00270     for (int b = 0; b < pulseIters.size(); ++b){
00271       TPulseIsland* pulse = *(pulseIters.at(b));
00272       //Need to define a comparison for CONSISTENT_TIME
00273       if ( std::abs(pulse->GetPulseTime() - min_time) < time_difference ) {
00274         //      printf("New Pulse\n");
00275         // Now loop through the samples
00276         std::vector<int> theSamples = pulse->GetSamples();
00277 
00278         // if we haven't set the size of temp_output yet, then reserve the number of elements we need
00279         if (temp_output.size() == 0) {
00280           for (int i = 0; i < theSamples.size(); ++i) {
00281             temp_output.push_back(0); 
00282           }
00283         }
00284         // if temp_output is larger than the given samples vector, reduce the size
00285         else if (temp_output.size() >= theSamples.size())
00286           temp_output.erase(temp_output.end() - (temp_output.size() - theSamples.size()), temp_output.end());
00287 
00288         for (std::vector<int>::iterator sampleIter = theSamples.begin(); sampleIter != theSamples.end(); ++sampleIter) {
00289           //printf("Value in pulse: %d\n", *sampleIter);
00290           //      printf("Value in temp_output: %d\n", temp_output.at(sampleIter - theSamples.begin()));
00291           if ( (sampleIter - theSamples.begin()) >= temp_output.size() )
00292             break;
00293 
00294           temp_output.at(sampleIter - theSamples.begin()) += *sampleIter;
00295         }
00296 
00297         //and increment the iterator because we used the island
00298         ++(pulseIters.at(b));
00299       }
00300     } // for (int b)
00301     output.push_back(temp_output);
00302 
00303     //Delete the iterators to finished banks. Go through in reverse to
00304     //avoid invalidation problems
00305     for (int b = pulseIters.size()-1; b >= 0 ; --b){
00306       if (pulseIters.at(b) == backwardIters.at(b)){
00307         pulseIters.erase(pulseIters.begin() + b);
00308         backwardIters.erase(backwardIters.begin() + b);
00309       }  
00310     } // for (int b -reversed)
00311   } // while (size > 0)
00312 
00313   return output;
00314 }
